name: 28-50 Wine Workshop & Kitchen
note: Basic: Dogs are allowed indoors, but it’s a more formal wine setting—on-lead and well-behaved is a must.

name: Abercamlais Arms
note: Basic: Traditional country pub vibes; dogs generally okay in the bar.

name: Aberglais Inn
note: Friendly: Known for being a "walker's pub"—dogs are warmly accepted indoors in the bar area.

name: Abuelo
note: Welcoming: A neighborhood favorite where pups are treated like regulars with plenty of indoor attention.

name: Adam & Eve
note: Friendly: Dogs are warmly welcomed in the bar and outdoor gardens with water bowls and a dedicated biscuit treat bucket on the counter.

name: Afternoon Tea at The Parlour
note: Red Carpet: Offers a full "Doggy Afternoon Tea" menu with canine nutrition in mind. Truly the VIP treatment.

name: Alema coffee
note: Friendly: Small but very welcoming to the morning dog-walking crowd.

name: Alice House Queen's Park
note: Friendly: Very accommodating to local dog owners; water bowls and treats are standard.

name: Allison's Eatery
note: Friendly: A vegan spot that extends its kindness to animals; dogs are welcome inside the dining area.

name: Altonapoli Italian Restaurant Kings Cross
note: Basic: Dogs are welcome inside and out, with standard amenities like water bowls provided upon request.

name: Anchor Cambridge
note: Basic: Restricted to the bar/terrace; standard amenities like water bowls are available.

name: Anspach & Hobday: The Arch House
note: Friendly: A classic "brewery dog" vibe. Very relaxed and inclusive of four-legged companions.

name: APULIA
note: Basic: Italian hospitality is great, but space is often tight; best for smaller, calm dogs.

name: ARABICA KINGS CROSS
note: Tolerant: Great terrace for pups, but they are restricted to the outdoor seating areas only.

name: Aragon House
note: Welcoming: Dogs are welcome in the bar, garden, and hotel rooms. They are well-known for their "pup-centric" staff.

name: Archers Tea Room & Coffee house
note: Friendly: Staff are notably affectionate toward pets; water and treats are usually ready and waiting.

name: Assembly House
note: Basic: Good local pub for dogs, though doesn't offer a specific dog-focused "menu" or zone.

name: Ave Mario
note: Tolerant: Due to the high-energy, packed nature of the restaurant, it’s best for dogs only on the terrace.

name: Babel Beerhouse
note: Friendly: A modern, inclusive taproom where dogs are warmly accepted alongside craft beer fans.

name: Bank House Hotel
note: Welcoming: As they allow dogs in all bedrooms and the restaurant.

name: BAO Kings Cross
note: Tolerant: Dogs are strictly allowed in the outside seating area only.

name: Barnabys Florists
note: Tolerant: Primarily a retail florist; dogs are tolerated for quick visits but no specific amenities are provided.

name: Baron of Beef
note: Welcoming: Provides water bowls and "tasty treats" for all "waggy tailed good boys and girls".

name: Barrafina Coal Drops Yard
note: Basic: Small, well-behaved dogs are allowed on-lead but must stay on the floor at all times.

name: Barrio - Soho (La Familia)
note: Tolerant: While technically allowed for drinks, the dark environment and loud music mean it is often not suitable for many dogs.

name: Battersea Brewery
note: Friendly: Highly welcoming both inside and out; they often have doggy treats ready at the bar.

name: Battersea Park
note: Red Carpet: An outdoor space with off-leash areas and even a doggy swimming spot.

name: Battersea Power Station
note: Friendly: The complex is very dog-friendly; many shops provide water and treats at the ready.

name: Bay Tree Cafe
note: Friendly: An independent cafe in Bury St Edmunds that explicitly lists itself as dog-friendly.

name: BEER + BURGER
note: Friendly: A casual spot that explicitly welcomes dogs to join for a pint and a burger.

name: Beer Shop | Hitchin
note: Friendly: A dedicated dog-friendly environment where four-legged friends are a standard sight.

name: Bella Vista
note: Basic: A dog-friendly guest house and dining area that provides standard access for pets.

name: Bellanger
note: Friendly: A very accommodating French brasserie where dogs are welcome throughout the entire restaurant.

name: Belmeis
note: Basic: Known as a neighborhood spot that allows dogs indoors, though it maintains a standard café environment without specific canine amenities.

name: Betjeman Arms
note: Friendly: A spacious St Pancras gastropub that welcomes dogs into its grand interior.

name: Betto Tapas Restaurant & Cocktail Bar
note: Friendly: Highly rated for welcoming dogs inside and out; they typically provide water bowls and have a designated terrace area.

name: Big Penny Social
note: Friendly: An open-hearted venue that warmly welcomes everyone and their dogs.

name: Birdcage
note: Friendly: Staff are self-proclaimed dog lovers who treat visiting pooches like royalty.

name: Bishop's Butchers
note: Tolerant: As a traditional butcher shop, dogs are tolerated for quick visits but have no amenities.

name: Bistrotheque
note: Friendly: Well-behaved dogs are welcome to sit quietly with their owners in this chic warehouse space.

name: Black Cock Inn
note: Friendly: Staff "shower pooches with treats" and provide water bowls near cozy log fires.

name: Black Rabbit Pub
note: Friendly: Features free treats on the bar and plenty of space in Maldon's biggest beer garden.

name: Black Sheep Coffee
note: Friendly: A cozy, inviting space that welcomes all dogs, big or small.

name: Blackfriars Antiques
note: Basic: Well-behaved dogs on leads are welcome; water and biscuits are usually available.

name: Bluebird
note: Welcoming: Voted one of London's best dog-friendly spots; pets are highly celebrated in the cafe and terrace.

name: Boosh
note: Friendly: A beautiful Grade 2 listed building that hosts a highly dog-friendly venue.

name: Bow Wow London
note: Red Carpet: While primarily a boutique/groomer, they provide VIP treats and beds for nearby hotels.

name: Brad & Dills
note: Friendly: As they are well-known local spots that accommodate pets as part of their community focus.

name: Brad & Dills
note: Friendly: As they are well-known local spots that accommodate pets as part of their community focus.

name: Bread Street Kitchen - Limehouse
note: Friendly: A "boathouse-inspired" waterside spot where the whole family, including dogs, is welcome both inside and on the terrace.

name: Brecon Tap
note: Friendly: A very welcoming ale and pie house where dogs are a common sight inside after local hikes and canal walks.

name: Brew Garden
note: Friendly: Known for a "pawsome time" with a warming ambience designed for families and their dogs.

name: BrewDog Canary Wharf
note: Welcoming: Famous for their "Paw-ties"; they are super dog-friendly throughout the large indoor space.

name: BrewDog Chancery Lane
note: Welcoming: Famous for their "Paw-ties"; they are super dog-friendly throughout the large indoor space.

name: BrewDog Clerkenwell
note: Welcoming: Famous for their "Paw-ties"; they are super dog-friendly throughout the large indoor space.

name: BrewDog Ealing
note: Welcoming: Famous for their "Paw-ties"; they are super dog-friendly throughout the large indoor space.

name: BrewDog Paddington
note: Welcoming: Famous for their "Paw-ties"; they are super dog-friendly throughout the large indoor space.

name: BrewDog Seven Dials
note: Welcoming: Famous for their "Paw-ties"; they are super dog-friendly throughout the large indoor space.

name: BrewDog Soho
note: Red Carpet: Dedicated "Paws of Fame" wall, pup menus (dog beer/sorbet), and £6 "Pawty" packages with hats and sundae.

name: BrewDog Tower Hill Outpost
note: Red Carpet: Dedicated "Paws of Fame" wall, pup menus (dog beer/sorbet), and £6 "Pawty" packages with hats and sundae.

name: BrewDog Wandsworth
note: Red Carpet: Dedicated "Paws of Fame" wall, pup menus (dog beer/sorbet), and £6 "Pawty" packages with hats and sundae.

name: BrewDog Waterloo
note: Red Carpet: Dedicated "Paws of Fame" wall, pup menus (dog beer/sorbet), and £6 "Pawty" packages with hats and sundae.

name: Brewhouse & Kitchen - Islington
note: Friendly: Explicitly welcomes well-behaved dogs in the bar area and provides homemade dog treats on request.

name: Bridge House
note: Welcoming: Dogs are treated to special snacks and can even join a "doggie hall of fame" on Instagram.

name: Briki
note: Friendly: A lively spot where it's common to see dogs resting by their owners' tables.

name: Brocket Arms
note: Friendly: A traditional country pub that welcomes dogs warmly in the bar area and outside.

name: Browns Cambridge
note: Friendly: A historic brasserie that welcomes dogs both inside the restaurant and in their outdoor seating areas.

name: Brutto
note: Friendly: Welcomes dogs into its warm, traditional Italian trattoria environment.

name: Bucks Head
note: Red Carpet: A true canine haven in Camden with a dedicated dog menu, indoor areas, and even waste bags provided.

name: Bull & Gate
note: Friendly: A historic community gastropub in Kentish Town that is officially dog-friendly and welcomes pets into its main bar areas.

name: Bull Highgate
note: Friendly: Traditional pubs that maintain a welcoming "local" atmosphere for neighborhood dogs.

name: Bulls Head
note: Friendly: Offers biscuits and fresh water with designated cozy nooks inside for you and your dog.

name: Bussey Rooftop Bar
note: Basic: They love "wooftop" guests on the roof, provided they stay on a lead and are well-behaved.

name: Cafe 77 Hitchin
note: Tolerant: Dogs are allowed but only in restricted areas (like outside) with no amenities.

name: Cafe Brera
note: Basic: Dogs allowed; standard facilities like a shared water bowl or a dog bin are available.

name: Cafe Foy
note: Basic: Dogs allowed; standard facilities like a shared water bowl or a dog bin are available.

name: Cafe in the Park
note: Basic: Dogs allowed; standard facilities like a shared water bowl or a dog bin are available.

name: Caffe Luna
note: Friendly: Known as a perfect pitstop for "feel-good food" while out with your pooch.

name: Caffe Massarella

name: Caffè Nero
note: Friendly: Very accommodating; dogs are allowed both upstairs and downstairs, with water often offered.

name: Canonbury Tavern
note: Friendly: A family and dog-friendly classic where furry friends are "always welcome".

name: Canton Arms
note: Friendly: Features a dog-friendly bar and a small outdoor area.

name: Caravan Exmouth Market Restaurant
note: Basic: Dogs are allowed in this lively market setting, with standard amenities like shared water bowls.

name: Caravan King's Cross Restaurant
note: Tolerant: Specifically restricted to outdoor seating only; dogs are not permitted inside the main dining room.

name: Cardies
note: Friendly: Dogs are warmly accepted indoors; water and basic treats are typically provided.

name: Carriage House Cafe
note: Basic: Dogs allowed; standard facilities like a shared water bowl or a dog bin are available.

name: Casa Pastor

name: Chequers
note: Basic: Dogs allowed; standard facilities like a shared water bowl or a dog bin are available.

note: Friendly: Dogs are warmly accepted indoors; water and basic treats are typically provided.

name: Colbert

name: Coopers Arms
note: Basic: Dogs allowed; standard facilities available.

name: Coqfighter Soho
note: Friendly: Dogs are welcomed inside this trendy spot, though the environment can get quite loud and buzzy.

name: Cowper Arms
note: Basic: A traditional pub setting where dogs are permitted in designated bar or garden areas.

name: Cowper Arms Hertford
note: Basic: Dogs are allowed throughout the pub and its large garden areas.

name: Craft & Cleaver
note: Basic: This American-style BBQ joint allows dogs in the bar area for those seeking a "dive bar" vibe with their pet.

name: Creature Comforts
note: Red Carpet: Being a pet store, they offer the ultimate welcome for dogs.

name: Cricklade House Hotel
note: Basic: Two specific rooms are dog-friendly; they are allowed elsewhere but strictly excluded from the conservatory.

name: Crooked Billet
note: Basic: A classic village pub where dogs are a common sight both in the bar and on the common outside.

name: Crossover Blendery
note: Basic: Standard dog-friendly brewery taproom environment where pets are welcome while you sample local beers.

name: Crutched Friar
note: Basic: Dogs are allowed in the bar and the outdoor courtyard, which is a rare find in this part of the City.

name: Cultivo Lounge
note: Friendly: Very dog-friendly with treats and water always available.

name: Currys
note: Friendly: Surprisingly welcoming for a retail shop; they permit dogs in the indoor bar area and the outdoor courtyard.

name: Cutty Sark
note: Friendly: Dogs are welcome on the ground floor bar of this riverside pub.

name: d'Arry's Restaurant, Bar & Cheesemonger
note: Basic: Dogs are allowed within this restaurant and bar setting, which offers a mix of traditional and modern dining.

name: De Beauvoir Arms
note: Basic: A neighborhood pub where dogs are permitted to join their owners in the bar area.

name: De Vere Cotswold Water Park
note: Basic: Pets are allowed at this lakeside hotel, making it a convenient stop for those traveling with dogs.

name: Devonshire Terrace
note: Friendly: Dogs are welcomed in the bar area and the impressive glass-covered outside terrace.

name: Dial Arch
note: Basic: This historic pub allows dogs throughout, offering plenty of space in its large indoor and outdoor areas.

name: Dinnio Restaurant
note: Tolerant: Dog access is strictly limited to the outdoor seating areas only.

name: Dishoom King's Cross
note: Tolerant: Dogs are allowed for alfresco dining only on the terrace; they are not permitted inside the restaurant.

name: Doctors Tonic
note: Basic: A standard dog-friendly pub environment in the heart of Welwyn Garden City.

name: Dog & Partridge Bury St Edmunds
note: Basic: Dogs are permitted in this traditional Greene King pub.

name: Dog & Whistle
note: Friendly: Exceptionally welcoming; well-behaved dogs are allowed "everywhere" in the pub and garden until 7 PM.

name: Doggy Doo’s
note: Friendly: As a professional groomer, dogs are the primary guests here and are fully accommodated.

name: Dogs Head
note: Basic: A dog-friendly town-center pub where pets are allowed in the bar areas.

note: Basic: Dogs are allowed within this modern bar and restaurant setting.

note: Basic: A traditional pub environment in Wales where dogs are permitted.
